metadata.title: CVE-2021-3520 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: There's a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to an application linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow, leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing an out-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is to availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity as well.

criterions.comment: lz4 package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-1ubuntu0.1').
